title.narrative: KEB Hana Indonesia Rights Issue IV

description.narrative:
Project level impact:
- Stakeholders- Improved access to finance for SME clients: The SME sector is underbanked and characterized by a relatively low level of debt. SMEs refrain from bank borrowing due to the high collateral requirements, complex procedures, stringent operational and reporting requirements and high interest rates. KHI plans to address this gap by prudently increasing provision of finance to un/underbanked SMEs in Indonesia in a structured, innovative, efficient and sustainable manner. This increase in SME lending is likely to contribute to economic growth, job creation, and poverty reduction.
- Stakeholders - Improved quality of financial services through digital financial services: The proposed project is expected to benefit end beneficiaries by expanding digital financial services ("DFS") and by incorporating data analytics in underwriting, resulting in better client-oriented product development and cost-efficient distribution of higher quality services. The project will strengthen last mile delivery and servicing of SME clients in an efficient, cost-effective, and sustainable manner.
Market level impact:
- Competitiveness: KHI is a midsize bank in Indonesia. The digital trend is unstoppable. Technology is disrupting Indonesian banks. Compared to traditional banks, financial technology companies are faster in deploying new technology and providing better customer experience. Customers are evolving, and banks must adapt to stay relevant. The project is expected to result in improved digital financial services and innovative product development for SME finance. It is anticipated, this would promote competition in the market and incentivize other banks to introduce customer focused products and efficient delivery mechanisms.

The proposed project consists of an additional equity investment by IFC in PT. Bank KEB Hana Indonesia (KHI or the Bank), IFC portfolio client since 2007. KHI is a midsize bank in Indonesia with an asset base of IDR 40,654 billion (US$2.7 billion). The proposed investment will support the Banks growth strategy and finance its capital investment in digital infrastructure to create the distribution and service channels for increasing the size of its lending operations in all business segments particularly in the SME segment. The Bank will be able to leverage its equity to expand the volume of its SME loan portfolio in a sustainable manner.

name.narrative: KHI is headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia and operates with 61 branches as of June 30, 2018.
